reviews_data.review_text: I really liked this place until this last experience. The guy literally would not break eye contact with me or move until I handed over my credit card. The second I walked in. It is a slow Monday at lunch.   I sat around and watched every other customer after me. No one got the same treatment
Alway's great food, drinks and service at Suffolk Punch. Love the flatbreads, Bang Bang Chicken Sammie and of course the Hazy IPA's. Highly recommend.
Eric was on point, fast and knowledgeable. He recommended food and it was great!

Inside and outside seating
Play area
Turf grass area
Bar area
Kid friendly
Great beer choices
Lots of seating
People were playing games inside
Kids played at the playground
Next to the Container Store
Mall entrance is next to it
Food appears good but, I had beer only
Good times. I shall return
Passing through Charlotte area, food was great, fun atmosphere for both adults and kids.

Had a wonderful lunch experience!  Server, Sydney, is fantastic! This was our first visit and Sydney eagerly explained everything about food and beverage items. We learned some of the history about how the brewery began and plans for future expansion. Our food was delicious. Sodas are served only in bottles because the owner feels they are more all natural ingredients. Beers are brewed off site, but served draft style from kegs. Well drinks and wines are also available. Coffee comes from the Coffee Shop attached to the restaurant. Coffee is brewed from HEX Coffee, a local business. Restrooms are actually individual stalls, in keeping with the Suffolk horse theme. Bar stools and chairs are comfy leather, also keeping with the equestrian theme. There are ample indoor and outdoor seating areas. Outdoor seating is in an all-season decor setting. This place has  kid friendly menus, and there are posters announcing Kids Outdoor Concerts. Looking forward to visiting their new location opening soon near Birkdale Village.

We had a large party here today for brunch. It was very hot outside. We sat at one of the large outside tables for an hour or so but eventually it just got a little too hot for the babies. I saw a large inside table and asked the outside waitress Laura if there was any chance we could move inside. After a few minutes she came back and said the inside staff was setting the table for us and they would help move everything inside. Not a hint of inconvenience from her, the hostess, the food runners, or our inside waitress.  Excellent service all around, and all the food and drinks were great. Ordering outside with the online tab was remarkably quick also. The indoor and outside space is well thought out and comfortable. Great community play area for kids just out front.

I had a first great experience with the girls greeting me as soon as I walked in. Then my server Danny took over and explained the wings to me and even gave me a small sample of one of the sauces. I even asked him about the kind of oil they use to cook and without hesitation he told me and even double checked. The teriyaki wings were huge. I will see you guys again next week when I work at the South park mall again. Thank you for the great first experience.

Ehh! Basic food, watered down drinks.
Adequate service - first come first serve seating and you order on your phone.
Lots of seating options (inside, outdoor covered and patio section) good view of playground area to watch the kiddos and convenient  walk to entrances of the mall.
The atmosphere is definitely better than the food.
Food and drink was excellent. Service also

1st time here! GREAT place! GREAT service! The biscuit bowl was awesome.
Caramel Iced Coffee was out of this world! We had the best waitress with her cute pigtails!!

Quick, friendly service and beautiful location, not to mention the coffee and food was absolutely delicious. A must stop for a brunch or breakfast. I will have to try the nighttime fair next time. I'll be back.
Good beer but bar service very slow (this was a Thursday), overcooked burger, extremely salty food overall even for someone who loves salt. Kids liked the playground.
Great beer and eats...really nice outdoor covered structure with plenty of tables
First time we went everything was so salty, was hoping a few months later it would be better. But I'm pretty sure it was worse. EVERYTHING was so gross!!!!

Idk why this place have so low raining, I love it. Coming here very often, at least couple times a week and food is always great as well as people who work here. Very nice and friendly atmosphere. And music is awesome too.

Today was my first time eating here. Veggie burger w/aioli sauce is REALLY good and has great flavor! The kale salad is also very good. The service is good and the music choices are  (alternative rock) Eat here!

A security guard in Southpark mall recommended this place to us as we were looking for a place to have lunch. We were greeted by a friendly host who explained the beers and food to us. Mimi took wonderful care of us and was extremely personable and friendly. She makes an incredible Old Fashioned. Coming here for lunch was one of the best experiences I have had in a restaurant  in a very long time, well done Suffolk Brewing!!

Lousy service. Food came less than 10
Minutes after we ordered. The server neglected to put in our starters. They came after our entry's were served. The fish and chips was over salted.   My husband asked for a dark beer. The server says there was a dark beer it was a Pilsner.
Will not go back again. It took us asking 3x tm get
I Love it the food was amazing and freshly made as well as the non alcoholic/alcoholic  beverages I would highly recommend this place.
Overpriced burger tasted like sea food and pussa lips good alcohol tho

Food is meh.  Prices high for what you get, even for South Park.  Biggest issue is the self service model.  Trying to charge these level of prices and offering self service is not going to work.  Ordered a charcuterie tray - someone set it down and said "would you like individual plates". We said "yes" and he said "you can grab them from that shelf over there." Sorry guys - too many good places with good service for this to work.  Transition to proper restaurant service and we might try again.

Realy nice to eat here. I liked the hamburger...
But recently I ate here and the hamburger was dry, and the fries were soggy..... I wonder what changed?
The fried chicken sandwich was good!
Sergio went out of his way to ensure we had a great experience. Unholy confessions is worth the trip, though make sure they fill your cup... a 12 oz. pour needs be filled at those prices.
Excellent venue with good food selection  light snacking with sliders n salad and top notch craft beer. Great social event.
Solid craft beers and a very nice varied food menu. Busy mall location

Came here for brunch and was seated immediately. I was lucky because they were booming. The drinks were tasty and the food was beyond delicious. They also have a coffee shop that unfortunately I didn't get to try.. next time! Give this place a try.
Food and drinks were great! I don't love the atmosphere! Too many strollers and children! Try the expresso martini!!

Our 1st visit.  Yes, it's Christmas time, and they were busy.  We sat in a "back room" that was dark and quite noisy.  We got lucky and there was a table of ladies talking loud enough that I'm sure their husband's could hear them at home.   Once they left I could hear myself think.  Our waitress was nice, yet it was one of those times we're you knew she was stretched too thin.  (As I walked out, she was having to serve tables outside that room.)  I ordered a diet coke that was delivered to the table in a small aluminum can with a cup of ice.  I decided on ice tea and it was good. As for the lunch order, I got the Grilled Chicken Panino.  It was very good.  As a side, I ordered the Crispy Brussels Sprouts.  They were tasty but loaded in oil.  It was a large bowl full.   My wife got the SPB Burger.  I got a taste of it and we both agreed it was good.  Her side was Hand Cut Belgian Fries.  They too were good.  My wife ordered a porter beer and enjoyed it.  Our daughter and our 2 yr old granddaughter was with us and we  decided to order the chicken strip with fries for the granddaughter.  There wasn't a children's meal selection,  yet she ate some of both.
Overall, we enjoyed ourselves yet aren't clamoring to return.    I'm not sure how much the bill was as I left before it came.  I asked my wife to take care of it.   The chairs that appear to be throughout the restaurant were uncomfortable for me.  By the time I got up, my back was hurting.   I wish those who return enjoy their meals.  However. I'm not recommending.
Brussels were in a bowl of oil and burger meat was unseasoned. No bueno.

Stopped in for lunch today. The service and the food were both great. Very nice atmosphere. I had the Chef's Burger with fries on the side. The Daydream Lager was awesome. Definitely worth checking out.

Beautiful modern brewery. They have a coffee shop too which is where I sat. They were offering free hot chocolate and a take home mug as part of the holiday hops event South Park mall was doing. I didn't partake in any food, but it was packed with folks that seemed to be enjoying what they ordered.
Really great place. The ahi tacos were great and so was the chicken biscuit
Great spot! Fun area for kids to run around and play as well. Really good beer and amazing food. For a brewery, the food is 10/10. Definitely a spot that South Park needed!
I stopped by this morning to grab a coffee and the iced chai was amazing. I love the atmosphere and seeing all the beautiful plants around the building. Great meet up spot for drinks and food!
Always great coffee!
Beet salad was amazing! Great atmosphere to come chill and have a pint.
Cool spot
Awesome atmosphere, location, and service. Family friendly and a wonderful social spot, definitely recommend!

I was visiting NC and found this place while shopping at Southpark Mall. What a great addition to the area. The staff was friendly, the drinks were awesome, and the finger foods were tasty. It's a pretty huge place with indoor and outdoor seating.
Kid friendly. Perfect place to stop and refuel before doing more shopping.
Little Gem salad no longer contains edamame, menu isn't current. Basically a little lettuce and a few onions.  Wonton is definitely crumbled.

I'm giving this place a 2 because of the cleanliness, attentive staff, and good drinks. The food is horrible. Had the fish and chips and there was no seasoning and it was so greasy.  the fries were soggy. We also ordered the calamari and it was also tasteless. We were starving but had to send the food back. We thought about going to the mall food court and bringing it back over. You may want to revamp your menu or allow customers to bring their own food.
Great space! Good beer. French fries need improving and have real utensils, as opposed to plastic, on the patio seating would be nice. Kids love the playground!
Under seasoned food everywhere. The only reason to go here is to grab a drink because you have to be at the mallThe only reason to go here is to grab a drink because you have to be at the mall.
Expensive I don't like ordering off my phone.  Menu is poorly done on phone with few words and no pictures

I took a group here 9/13. We had dinner
I had a cheeseburger and fries and the October's Ale. Our server Evan was very good and everyone said their food was great. This is my 2nd time here. We had our own room which was nice. Highly recommend!

I ordered the chicken bisquit and it is man-size! The chicken is tender and and the gravy is well flavored. The eggs are done just right, the gravy well seasoned. The bisquits were good, but a little rubbery. The ale was excellent, I ordered the Marshmallow Tree Top and expected a little more marshmallow. It had a nice mellow flavor. My boyfriend had the sausage eggs and bacon. The sausage was very well spiced and tender. The service was fast and friendly. I would give this place 4 1/2 stars if I could as they try very hard and I will come back to try other dishes. All in all it was a great experience. I plan to bring more people here too!
Much better food than the south end location and our server Kayla was great! Awesome atmosphere as well.
Great service and incredible food!

Good outdoor atmosphere and free form environment for all different types of patrons. Super convenient method of ordering food, and rapid fast with bringing food out. Definitely a place to hit the bar late or come in the morning for that hangover brunch. Good vibes and good foods here, espresso is ok, nothing special
Chef's burger was the best burger I've ever had, was very happy

Amazing place
Great food and beer
Wonderful service
Looking forward to my next visit

I give one star because the beer was good, however, it was the worst burger we ever had. The bun was too small and not substantial enough for the burger - and both of our burgers were stone cold (even though sitting at the bar we saw it come out and we were served pretty quickly) and tasteless. The fries were soggy and cold. Disappointing.
Great addition to the mall. Awesome atmosphere, great food and drinks. Definitely recommend the burger.
Excellent for sharing ... I recommended it in every way...

The place is  kid friendly and service is great  but the food is nothing close to what we get in Suffolk punch south end. The burgers were poorly assembled and without any flavor. You are paying premium price for poor quality. We will probably go to South end next time!

I was interested in trying this place since it was new to South Park. I stopped by for a weekend lunch but I was underwhelmed. I ordered the  Little Chicken Biscuit. The biscuit was hard and chewy, not light and fluffy as a biscuit should be, The chicken was well cooked and the accompanying potatoes were tasty. However, the flawed biscuit really messed up the sandwich. I ended up taking the chicken off and just eating it without the biscuit. That defeats the purpose of the sandwich.

I mentioned this to the server and the manager. They both acknowledged problems with getting the biscuit right. The manager said they were working on adjustments in the cooking process to correct the issue. If it is not right,  you know it's not right, it shouldn't be on the menu until you can get it right.

Disappointing experience. Not sure I would return here. Legion, OMB, Middle James are better brewery/restaurant options in my opinion.
Every food item we ordered (5 people) was extremely salty. Cocktails were not good.

I give 5 stars for a majority of the reviews I write. I am always only looking for a pretty good meal with semi-attentive service, in an environment with some vibe. This establishment had none of that. I'm giving it 1 star because the two hazy brews we ordered were delish! Hamburger, pink was done through and through. Hot chicken sandwich was a pimento cheese sandwich with some over fried thighs. We walked from our condo past two of our favorite places to visit and wanted to like it.....it simply did NOT happen.
It is weird is 2023 to find a restaurant using single use plastic silverware for every guest but here we are. It was just wasteful and the food was mediocre on top.
Great family friendly spot!

Overpriced sweatbox! The places main outdoor patio averages 10degrees warmer than the parking lot, the food is ehhhh, pretzel is $12 and size of my hand, hummus was watery, and pizza spongy. The mixed drinks average $14 and come in small plastic cups. No severs which i like yet the tip options still want 18-25% for NO service.... Legion is a far better option all around-
Food and service were both on point. I'll definitely be back when in town.

Food is amazing, drinks are good as well. Hostess wasn't too nice, but we decided to sit out in the patio, bartenders are great. We love coming here and our kids get to enjoy the playground. We had tuna tacos and calamari

I had brunch at Suffolk Punch Brewing at their new Southpark location. I am a huge fan of this brewery and have been to their location at South End many times.  Suffolk Punch makes fantastic beer, and the food is outstanding.  I tried their breakfast sandwich with a chicken breast, bacon, a fried egg and lettuce & tomato.  It was so tasty.  The house salad is also very good.  Suffolk Punch knows how to do it right. I look forward to coming back to both locations.
Great little spot to get a refreshment after some shopping, good staff, good beer
Incredible flavor and interesting menu.  Suffolk Punch Brewing definitely left an impression on me! Rachel B. Was a phenomenal bartender.
Excellent balance in bitter and body. A really good coffee place !!
Great place, beer/wine/cocktails, great service. Love Leo!

Great food, sat at the bar and had good service. Ahi tuna tacos were really good and their spicy chicken sandwich is amazing! We've been twice since they opened and enjoyed everything we tried. Good atmosphere inside, lots of kids outdoors. We'll be back!
Came with many friends. While I checked on kids at playground, half out table was cleared and my food and beer thrown out.

Still ironing out some bugs, as all new restaurants do. The hostess stand is in a VERY odd location in the center of the restaurant, not near any entrance. The girl took my name and number, and I got a confirmation text that I was added to the list. However, 1 minute later, I discovered I was removed from the waitlist.

We were still seated at the promised time, however, despite being accidentally removed from the list.

I was seated and had to wait quite a while before I was approached by waitstaff - I think the hostess didn't let the waitress know that we were there.

After that, though, it was smooth sailing. Our waitress, Heather, was very attentive and did a good job being cordial and taking our orders.

The food was pretty dang good, too. We had the tuna nachos, and these are a MUST HAVE appetizer. They were delicious. My main dish - the hot chicken sandwich - was extremely spicy. I was surprised that such a hot sandwich was offered to the general public. It came to me in a puddle of red oil and was basically too spicy to eat, I could not finish it because my mouth was on fire.

My wife ordered the salmon and roasted carrot salad and loved it.

Overall, the food and service was mostly pretty good - but the front of the house needs some help. Oh, and tone down the spice on the hot chicken sandwich, please.
Very nice space with varied seating options. An excellent addition to the changing scene at South Park. Good craft beer selection
We had a great night here. Food was outstanding and the we code order system works well. Would be great if there was a free EV charger close by.

Excellent service and hugh indoor and outdoor seating where you can bring kids and dogs. Gerren is by far the  best bartender with great smile. I am so happy we finally have a place like this! It is simply awesome!

Beers were good, food was incredibly overpriced for what we received. I understand this is in the South-park mall but come on. We got 2 beer, an 8"x4" flatbread and a salad that had about 1 cup of lettuce and 1/4 of a burrata ball, already torn (half the fun of burrata is cutting it open yourself)
Disappointed that we spent $55 on that.. service was okay

We had a fantastic experience at the new location at South Park! We were a large party (11) who were able to be seated on a busy Saturday in record time. Our tables were in a section off the main dining and almost felt like a private room. Our server was super sweet and attentive. The ordering system here will stun you--the server sends back your order instantly and runners bring it out moments later... our drinks, apps and kids' meals were delivered in minutes! Again, this was prime time on a rainy Saturday with a Charlotte FC game on! Food is high quality as always, inventive and delicious. Get the brussels and pretzel with cheese sauce!!!! My only complaint... PLEASE bring the Sangria to South Park!!!  The mamas need it. (Tropical Tree Tops was a solid choice in its absence though.)

This happened a few days ago, I believe it was opening week and we should have some issues cleared up, hope to come back soon and re-evaluate the place. The place has a huge flow of people, it's huge since it's close to one of the Mall's entrances. I walked around the place and sat down on my own, after 3 minutes a server came and took me to the Host who took me to another place with another server, they brought me the menu and asked for water. 10 minutes passed and the server did not come back. I was very hungry that day and decided to retire to eat somewhere else.
Good Vibes! Enjoyed the food and drinks with friends during an after work happy hour. Staff could be a bit more attentive.

This location new SouthPark did not disappoint! (Big fan of Suffolk Punch SouthEnd too!) The vibe is very brewery meets restaurant meets greenhouse. They had some incredible outdoor sitting areas which was perfect this time of year and plenty of indoor seating too. The food was phenomenal! We tried the  Queen City Pretzel, Ahi Tuna Tacos,  Miso Roasted Sockeye Salmon, Fish & Chips, The Veggiest Burger & Grapefruit Soda. The flavor combinations were spot on! While it has only been open for a few days we were pleasantly surprised how quick the food came out & how amazing the service was.
Nice looking place, horrible fish and chips.
Love Suffolk Punch and so excited to be walking distance--but we need Jaw rippers at this location!

Our experience here was wonderful! The food and drinks were delicious. Our server, Brandon, was wonderful. His service was amazing. He made great suggestions, and quite frankly, everything he suggested sounded good. If we had more time, we would have eaten more.  Whenever I make it back to Charlotte, I am absolutely going to make a stop at this spot again.

Great food, awesome drinks, beautiful atmosphere but the STAR of my visit was my server BRANDON! He was simply amazing! He had great recommendations for food and drink, asked all the right questions to direct us to food choices that would satisfy our table of real foodies and he knew the menu back and forth. Aside from the aforementioned, Brandon possesses the "it" factor that will make any visit to this place enjoyable. Ask for him by name. The experience is top tier.

Brandon, our waiter, was AMAZING!!! Very knowledgeable, nice and attentive. The fish, flat bread and drinks (Strawberry Fields) he recommended were delicious!! Thanks for such a great experience, Brandon!!

Killer food, tuna nachos were an excellent starter and the spicy chicken sandwich was amazing. It's very South Park-ish but all in I was really surprised by the quality of food and service. Will be returning again!

Great spot. Food on point, drinks cold, bathroom clean,atmosphere looks so cool. Coming right back! I had the truffle fries and brussels sprouts, let's go! Waiter was cool even the dude that cleaned up the table asked me how my food was. What the heck!
Brandon was awesome! Super knowledgeable and very friendly! We didn't feel like making decisions on Mothers Day weekend and he picked the most delicious options for us! 10/10
Fantastic food and service!
